H0.text: Which order of insects contains the most species. Butterfly

H1.text: Which order of insects contains the most species. Ant

H2.text: Which order of insects contains the most species. Fly

H3.text: Which order of insects contains the most species. Beetel

A4.text: The Coleoptera, with about 400,000 described species, is the largest of all orders, constituting almost 40% of described arthropods and 25% of all known animal species

A5.text: Multiple studies posit that Diptera (flies) and/or Hymenoptera (sawflies, wasps, ants and bees) may have more species

A6.text: Over 150,000 living species of Hymenoptera have been described, in addition to over 2,000 extinct ones.

A7.text: More than 150,000 have been formally described
